p: At present, there is no standard guideline or consensus for the treatment of Kimura's disease. The main treatment for Kimura's disease is surgical removal of the mass and pathological examination, and continue treatment after surgery. According to previous literature, there are hormone therapy, radiotherapy, immunotherapy and treatment of ischemic vascular reconstruction ( 14, 15). For those masses that cannot be completely removed, postoperative radiotherapy is more important. Research has shown that surgical excision combined with low-dose radiotherapy shows better results than surgical excision or radiotherapy alone ( 16). Because the boundary of the mass was clear and the mass was completely removed during the operation, we did not give the patient radiotherapy after the operation.
